author: Michael Hibdon
title: Boston Hotels like Boston Park Plaza Visitors Who Come to Enjoy the Many Performing Arts Events
text:
Boston Events like The Book of Mormon and concerts like Madonna are reminders of why so many people come to the City to enjoy the performing arts. Boston Hotels like Boston Park Plaza Hotel are located near the top venues for these and other events. Boston Park Plaza offers to welcome those who come to enjoy all the best that the City has to offer. View offer details > Boston theatres and concert venues offer an array of offerings throughout the year. In September, The Book of Mormon and Madonna’s Rebel Heart Tour will be two of most popular choices.
Book of Mormon
September 1 through October 11, 2015
Citi Emerson Colonial Theatre | 106 Boylston Street Boston, MA 02116
Tel: 617.482.9393
Since this show opened on Broadway in 2011, it has been the recipient of top awards and it remains an audience favorite. The show has won an impressive 9 Tony Awards, and it now can be seen at Boston’s Citi Emerson Colonial Theatre for a 40-day run. The Book of Mormon is a religious satire that follows the exploits of 2 missionaries who travel to Uganda. Tickets for The Book of Mormon are available through TicketMaster or at the box office at the theatre.
Madonna
September 26, 2015
TD Garden | 100 Legends Way Boston, MA 02114
Tel: 617.624.1050
Madonna has been a fixture on the pop music scene for more than 30 years. This is an early stop on the Rebel Heart Tour, which begins September 9th in Canada. Madonna, who is 57 years old, embarks on the Rebel Heart Tour to support her 13th album. This will be her 10th tour. Tickets for this Boston events start at $90 with premium seats going for up to $355.
TD Garden and Citi Emerson Colonial Theatre are 2 of the many venues where Boston events in the performing arts take place. Those planning a visit can check the websites of these and other venues for full schedules of upcoming events. Boston Park Plaza is an ideally-located Boston hotel that is near event venues, shopping, dining, and attractions.
